JobTitle: Strategy, Market Intelligence and Analytics Director
JobFullDesc: Strategy, Market Intelligence and Analytics Director, Client Solutions GroupJoin us as Strategy, Market Intelligence and Analytics Director on our Client Solutions Group Strategy & Market Intelligence team in Austin, TX or remote to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.What you’ll achieveThe Client Strategy & Market Intelligence Team helps the executive leadership of the Client Solutions Group track and forecast industry trends to inform planning and go-to-market/product strategy for Dell’s worldwide PC business.  We are looking for an analytical and creative team member who will be responsible for:Acting as a “Product Manager” for our Market Intelligence function, including:Defining and creating of market forecasts using advanced analytical methods such as machine learningDeveloping competitive and market insights based on primary and secondary researchDefining and developing analytical tools that help drive insights from our financial and operational dataCollaborating with key stakeholders including the Dell Client Solutions leadership team across the business to align insights and understand impacts to operational plansDeveloping a diverse team of business and data analytics resources to drive insights for our leadership team and other key stakeholdersPreferred qualificationsand requirements:MBA or analytics-oriented Master’s degree preferred3+ years post-MBA/Masters experience7+ year of experience driving data and research based business insightsExperience managing and developing high performing teams in strategy and analyticsProduct management expertise, ideally on a data analytics based software solutionExperience in using statistical analysis and data science to drive corporate decision makingExpertise with advanced and analytical and statistical methods and tools (e.g., k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, etc.)Expertise in advanced qualitative, quantitative and hybrid market research methodologiesDemonstrated skills in data visualization (Power BI, Power Point), presentation, and interpersonal interactionDeep understanding of current technology trends and marketsExperience in managing 3rd party vendors and proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneouslyAdvanced analytical and business problem solving skills, including financial analysis abilityAbility to work effectively across time zones – US, Europe and AsiaHere’s our story; now tell us yoursDell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment.
